paragraphs.text: Argentina's Debt Crisis: Country turns to UN to avoid accountability.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Defaulting on sovereign debt is never a good strategy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Just ask Argentina
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The South American nation has defaulted 10 times- -most recently this summer--on its international obligations and has experienced sharp economic decline as a result
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In the early 1900s, Argentina ranked among the world's top 10 in per capita income
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: By 2012, it had fallen to 55th
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Rather than
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: learn anything from this unhappy history
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: however
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Argentina is opting for stubbornness, bullying and intimidation of its debt-holders, all with a helping hand from the United Nations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it refuses to pay back bondholders for billions of dollars
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What Argentina wants is to establish "a multilateral legal framework for sovereign debt restructuring processes."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Such a multilateral endeavor -- established, run, and funded by governments -- will no doubt be more sympathetic to financial deadbeats like Argentina than a U.S  court that has to give equal standing to the private sector
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's also the kind of thing that the United Nations loves to endorse: high- minded and technical sounding, larded with ostensible respect for international legal processes, and standing above any single national interest--with absolutely no chance whatsoever that it will be any of these things
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sure enough, Argentina has successfully rallied a majority of U.N  member nations to join in denouncing Argentina's debt holders and endorsing its multilateral debt restructuring framework
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This September the U.N  General Assembly voted 124-11, with 41 abstentions, to support Argentina's position
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The U.N  Human Rights Council soon followed suit, adopting a similar resolution 33-5, with 9 abstentions
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The notorious Council, which includes some of the world's worst human rights violators in its membership, got involved because it says excessive debt is an impediment to full realization of "social, economic and cultural" rights
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It is certainly true that debt defaults take a huge toll
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the defaulting country loses access to international financial markets and foreign exchange, limiting its ability to finance expenditures and obligations and pay for imported goods
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The end result is typically sharp recession and rising unemployment
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But Argentina's latest default is is different from earlier defaults
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which were driven by economic crises
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The 2014 crisis, though rooted in a previous $100 billion default that occurred 13 years ago, is a deliberate--and unnecessary--choice of the Argentine government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2005 and 2010, Argentina offered to exchange bonds that it had defaulted on at about 35 cents on the dollar
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Eventually
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: about 93 percent of debt holders agreed to the swap
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Some debt holders, however, held out and went to U.S  court arguing that Argentina had to pay them the full value of their bonds
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In 2012, a U.S  judge ruled in their favor and further ruled that any financial institution that assisted in partial payment would be in contempt
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Following the court's ruling, Argentina could have complied or at least paid interest on the bonds while trying to renegotiate a more favorable debt arrangement
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead, this summer it decided to pay nothing, abandon negotiations, and rely on demagoguery to press its case in the court of public opinion
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Argentina has denounced its debt holders--shrilly and often--as "vulture" funds
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Of course, it never mentions that it was Argentina that voluntarily issued the debt in the first place, presumably in good faith
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Nor does it acknowledge that the government's own reckless economic policies precipitated the debt crisis in the first place
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If you think that sort of dishonest name-calling would fall on deaf ears, you don't know the United Nations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Argentina's success in rallying a majority of U.N  member nations to join in denouncing the debt holders results from an underlying fact
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At the U.N  the agenda of many developing nations consists of blaming others for the consequences their poor economic choices and demanding that the developed nations provide more aid, less accountability for money already given, and no right to object when feckless countries misbehave
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The U.N  resolutions in support of Argentina do not have the force of law
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: But the intended goal is clearly to establish a "a multilateral legal framework for sovereign debt restructuring processes" via a treaty or international convention
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Historically, U.N  resolutions are the first step in this process
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That is clearly the hope of Hector Timerman, Argentina's Minister for Foreign Affairs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who made clear why his country had pressed so hard to get the resolutions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Vulture funds will not stop until we put the brake on...," he declared
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "The resolution not only condemns vulture's activities, but also urges the UN to investigate their behavior and analyze their effect over sovereign economies."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: In other words, he is arguing: Let's point the finger at someone else to avoid responsibility for our own economic failings
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As the U.S  made clear in its statement opposing the effort, if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the terms of debt obligations are subject to review, renegotiation, or negation by a government as it feels like it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the cost of lending to everyone will rise to meet the perceived risk
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Indeed many countries may find it impossible to access international capital markets at all
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And many of the countries hardest hit will be a lot poorer than Argentina, a middle income country that has never learned to live within its means
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: U.N.-endorsed demagoguery is no way to resolve a problem of habitual economic and fiscal incompetence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Unfortunately, however, it may be an effective means for seducing other countries to join Argentina in the misery of being a financial pariah
paragraphs.label: assumption
